title: Set up database for multi-user support
description:
Implement database layer for storing user accounts, subscriptions, and image metadata. Recommended: Cloudflare D1 (serverless SQL) for seamless integration with existing Cloudflare Workers backend.

Schema requirements:
- users: id, email, password_hash, created_at, subscription_tier, api_token
- images: id, user_id, r2_key, filename, size_bytes, created_at, delete_token
- subscriptions: id, user_id, tier, status, current_period_end, stripe_subscription_id, storage_limit_bytes
- storage_usage: user_id, total_bytes_used, image_count, last_updated

This is foundational for all other SaaS features.

title: Design subscription tier pricing model
description:

- Bandwidth limits (optional)

- Image retention policy

title: Implement storage quota enforcement
description:
Add storage quota tracking and enforcement per user tier:

Requirements:
- Track storage usage in real-time on upload
- Check quota before accepting uploads
- Reject uploads that exceed user's tier limit
- Return clear error messages with upgrade prompts
- Background job to recalculate usage periodically
- Admin dashboard to monitor storage across users

Quota checks:
- Before upload: verify user hasn't exceeded limit
- On upload success: increment storage_usage.total_bytes_used
- On delete: decrement storage_usage.total_bytes_used
- Periodic audit: reconcile DB usage with actual R2 usage

Error responses:
- 402 Payment Required when quota exceeded
- Include current usage and tier limit in response
- Suggest upgrade to next tier

Performance considerations:
- Use atomic operations for usage updates
- Cache current usage in memory (with TTL)
- Optimize for high-frequency upload scenarios
